**Reproducible in staging?:** Needs Reproduction (Unable to reproduce)
**Reproducible in production?:** Needs Reproduction

**Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):**
**Logs:** https://stackoverflow.com/c/expensify/questions/4856
**Expensify/Expensify Issue URL:**
**Issue reported by:** 
**Slack conversation** (hyperlinked to channel name): [#Expensify Bugs](https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C049HHMV9SM/p1769488605042329)

## Action Performed:

1. Opened and reviewed all Inbox messages
2. Cleared browser cache
3. Uninstalled and reinstalled the app
4. Synced the account

## Expected Result:
Messages that have already been viewed should:
Be marked as read
Be removed from the Inbox or no longer surface as new
## Actual Result:
Previously reviewed messages reappear in the Inbox.
Messages behave as though they were never opened.
## Workaround:
Unknown

- [ ] MacOS: Chrome / Safari

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel!
___

**Version Number:** 9.3.11.0
**Reproducible in staging?:** Yes
**Reproducible in production?:** N/A - new feature, doesn't exist in prod
**If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** https://github.com/Expensify/App/pull/80672
**Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** ibellicotest+2250@gmail.com
**Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team
**Bug source:** Exploratory - Significant User Experience Deterioration
**Device used:** Motorola MotoG60 / Android 12 (Hybrid app) - Windows 11 / Chrome
**App Component:** Search

## Action Performed:
1. Open the Expensify app. 
2. Create a manual expense with date from last month and submit it to any 1:1 chat.
3. Navigate to "Reports" > "Top Merchants"
4. Note that expense is displayed despite not being part of a workspace.
5. Note that expense shows negative amount.

## Expected Result:
Expenses from 1:1 chats shouldn´t appear on "Top Merchants" as they aren´t part of a workspace.

## Actual Result:
Expenses from 1:1 chats appear on "Top Merchant" section despite not being part of workspaces.

## Workaround:
Unknown

labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 9.3.11-0 **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** No **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** https://test-management.browserstack.com/projects/2219752/folder/13176910/test-cases/41237481 **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** N/A **Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team **Bug source:** Regression TC Execution **Device used:** iPhone 15 iOS 26.2 **App Component:** Left Hand Navigation (LHN) ## Action Performed: 1. Sign in as User A on iOS and User B on secondary device 2. Send some messages from both users 3. As User A, make sure there is no unread messages in the chat, navigate to the Inbox 4. As User B, send a message to User A 5. As User A, observe the LHN - chat is in unread status (bold), the new message appears, do not open the chat 6. As User B, delete the message 7. User A, observe the chat in the LHN again ## Expected Result: The conversation unread status is dismissed as the newest message was deleted. The previous message sent in chat is shown in LHN ## Actual Result: The chat is in unread status, the deleted message still shown in LHN for User A. When User A opens the chat, the message is shown with an unread marker for a few seconds, then disappears ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [ ] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [x] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [ ] Windows: Chrome - [ ] MacOS: Chrome / Safari ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/1833e18c-78e2-4c2f-a77c-252a4c45aa7f [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

Connect a direct (not Plaid) company card feed on a collect workspace. 2. Wait the period of time before reauthentication is required to assign cards (usually 15 min). 3. Tap to assign a card. ## Expected Result: You're prompted to reauthenticate with the bank AND RHP on web shows page about popup window opening. ## Actual Result: You're prompted to reauthenticate with the bank but RHP shows company card upgrade page. We should only show the upgrade page if you try to add a second card feed on a collect workspace, not to assign a card. ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: Select the officially supported platforms where the issue was reproduced: - [ ] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari ## Screenshots/Videos [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

title: SMS to Short Code 4777: No Unsupported-Text Response Received

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Help Wanted
labels.description: Apply this label when an issue is open to proposals by contributors

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel!
___

**Version Number:** v9.3.8-0
**Reproducible in staging?:** Yes
**Reproducible in production?:** Yes
**If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** https://test-management.browserstack.com/projects/2219752/test-runs/TR-3371/folder/13177084/41237989/1145199806?sort=%2Bidentifier
**Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** 2798427606
**Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team
**Bug source:** Regression TC Execution
**Device used:** iOS
**App Component:** Other

## Action Performed:
1. On the Phone, open the messaging app
2. Navigate to the "Message" app
3. Open the message thread with "4777"
4. Type a plain text message (e.g., "Lunch at Chipotle", "Meeting expenses", "Test message") in the message body
5. Send the SMS message
6. Verify that a response is received indicating text-only messages are not supported.

## Expected Result:
When sending a plain text SMS (e.g., “Lunch at Chipotle”, “Meeting expenses”, “Test message”) to the short code 4777, the system should return an automated SMS response indicating that text-only messages are not supported (a reply confirming the message type isn’t accepted).

## Actual Result:
After sending the plain text SMS to 4777, no SMS response was received at all — no indication that text-only messages are not supported, and no error/auto-reply came back.

After some time I got message: "Hi there, thanks for reaching out! How may I help?"

Sending plain text message again triggered another message:
"It looks like you may have accidentally forwarded a receipt to me. If you meant to send this receipt to your Expensify account, could you please re-forward it to receipts@expensify.com instead?  
Otherwise, if you have any questions, I'm happy to help!"

## Workaround:
Unknown

## Platforms:
- [ ] Android: App
- [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome
- [x] iOS: App
- [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari
- [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome
- [ ] Windows: Chrome
- [ ] MacOS: Chrome / Safari

title: Amex Direct Feed Cards Remain Unassigned in New Expensify After Migration

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Help Wanted
labels.description: Apply this label when an issue is open to proposals by contributors

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel!
___

**Version Number:** 9.3..3-8
**Reproducible in staging?:** Needs Reproduction (Reproduction blocked)
**Reproducible in production?:** Needs Reproduction
**If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:**
**Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):**
**Logs:** https://stackoverflow.com/c/expensify/questions/4856
**Expensify/Expensify Issue URL:**
**Issue reported by:** @Leeckhart
**Slack conversation** (hyperlinked to channel name): [#Expensify Bugs](https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C049HHMV9SM/p1769520925052579)

## Action Performed:
1. In Classic: Navigate to Settings → Domains → [Domain Name] → [Workspace] → Settings
2. Set and save the workspace as the preferred workspace
3. Same process applied successfully to all other card feeds (e.g., Chase)
4. In New Expensify: Navigate to Workspaces → [Workspace] → Company Cards → American Express Cards (Direct feed)
5. Observe the card list displayed
## Expected Result:
All Amex cards associated with the domain should:
Appear in New Expensify
Be automatically assigned based on existing Classic assignments
Match the behavior of other migrated card feeds
## Actual Result:
Only one Amex card  is assigned and  the remaining 9 Amex cards are unassigned in New Expensify.
## Workaround:
Unknown
## Platforms:
Select the officially supported platforms where the issue was reproduced:
- [ ] Android: App
- [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome
- [ ] iOS: App
- [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari
- [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome
- [x] Windows: Chrome

**Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team
**Bug source:** Regression TC Execution
**Device used:** iphone promax 13, IOS 26.2
**App Component:** Money Requests

## Action Performed:
Preconditions:
1. On Web, sign in with a new account on OldDot (staging.expensify.com)
2. user directed to ND, select option Manage my team 1 -10, then continue with onboarding flow
3. Ensure a workspace is created
4. Switch to old dot then Create a new report
5. Add 3 expenses to the report and don't submit it
6. Open the console and run the following snippet:
`NVP.set('tryNewDot', {classicRedirect: {dismissed: false, timestamp: '2024-01-07'}, nudgeMigration: {timestamp: '2024-01-07'}});`
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Perform on IOS app
1. Launch the app 
2. Sign in with the same account (switch to ND, if you are happen to be on OD)
3. Verify that the "Welcome to New Expensify!" modal is displayed
4. Tap "Lets go"
5. Verify you are redirected to the Reports page
6. Tap on the Expense report 
7. Navigate away then return to the same expense report

## Expected Result:
No loading animation should persist once the report is fully loaded.

## Actual Result:
under The total amount section shows an endless loading spinner.

## Workaround:
Unknown

**Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team
**Bug source:** Exploratory - Significant User Experience Deterioration
**Device used:** Windows 11
**App Component:** Other

## Action Performed:
1.Open a group chat
2.Open a task report
3.Click the report header
4.Select Details
5.Click Delete
6.Confirm deletion

## Expected Result:
User is redirected back to the parent group chat after deleting the task report.

## Actual Result:
User remains on the deleted task report screen after confirming deletion. The task no longer exists but the UI stays on the task view, leaving the user in an invalid report context. Other delete flows redirect correctly, making this behavior inconsistent.

## Workaround:
Unknown

___

**Version Number:** 9.3.10.0
**Reproducible in staging?:** Yes
**Reproducible in production?:** Yes
**If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** https://test-management.browserstack.com/projects/2219752/test-runs/TR-3693/folder/18717689/49855697/1152506254?q=no+workspace&issue_type=jira
**Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** ibellicotest+2250@gmail.com
**Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team
**Bug source:** Exploratory - Significant User Experience Deterioration
**Device used:** Motorola MotoG60 / Android 12 (Hybrid app) - Windows 11 / Chrome
**App Component:** Workspace Settings

## Action Performed:
1. Open the Expensify app. 
2. Sign up with a new account. 
3. Complete onboarding modal selecting "Track and budget expenses" and without creating any workspace.
4. Create a manual expense and submit it to Self DM.
5. Open the just created expense.
6. Tap on "Category" field.
7. Tap on "Upgrade" and confirm the workspace creation.
8. Tap on "Got it, thanks"
9. Navigate to "Workspaces" and open the just created workspace.
10. Tap on "Workflows"
11. Enable "Approvals" and "Payments"
12. Return to workspace menu.
13. Note that a RBR appeared on "Account" section.
14. Navigate to "Account"
15. Note that no error is visible on any section of "Account"

## Expected Result:
No RBR or error should appear on "Account" section after enabling "Approvals" and "Payments" on a workspace created via "Upgrade" flow.

## Actual Result:
After enabling "Approvals" and "Payments" on a workspace created via category field "Upgrade" flow, an RBR appears on "Account" section. RBR can´t be dismissed as no error can be found.

## Workaround:
Unknown

**Bug source:** Exploratory - Significant User Experience Deterioration
**Device used:** Mac 26.1 / Chrome
**App Component:** Money Requests

## Action Performed:
Precondition:
- Admin invites member to the workspace.

1. Go to staging.new.expensify.com
2. [Member] Open workspace chat.
3. [Member] Create an expense. Do not click Submit on the expense preview.
4. [Admin] Open member's expense report.
5. [Admin] Click More > Split > Save.
6. [Admin] Go to admin's workspace chat.
7. [Admin] Click + > Create expense > Manual.
8. [Admin] Create an expense.
9. [Admin] Go to member's workspace chat.

## Expected Result:
The expense will be created in admin's workspace chat.

## Actual Result:
The expense is created in member's workspace chat after admin splits member's expense and submits expense in own's workspace chat.

## Workaround:
Unknown
